title: Ticket #6988: invoke SIngularity with special command that brings in NVIDIA drivers
description:
Abandoned, dup of #6989

What Docker and Singularity call the “NVIDIA runtime” is basically this: * nvidia has a tool which you run and it produces a list of files on stdout * docker / singularity bind mount those files inside the container (or equivalent operations) * thus one is reasonably assured of having the same libraries inside the container as are running the kernel

Request_gpus > 0 should trigger this singularity option. This solves a fairly fundamental problem in portability of GPU code.
